resource.name: nutty_bolts

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies operators for defining shapes and networks in terms of symmmetry primitives.
The primitives include mapping and structuring primitives and a mechanism for using primitives to structure other primitives

outscope.li: specification of shape geometry or topology.

definition.def: a characteristic of an object and a function that transforms the object but does not change this characteristic.

schema.name: nut_and_bolt_1_schema

introduction.p: The subject of the nut_and_bolt_1_schema is the specification of operators for symmetry primitives.
This is a very interesting subject, or is it?
introduction.example: The discrete or continuous translation of an axis.

schema.fund_cons: Objects can be classified by the symmetries they exhibit of their shapes when they are transformed by rotations and translations.An infinite screw thread is invariant under a helical transformation

schema.name: nut_and_bolt_2_schema
schema.introduction: The subject of the nut_and_bolt_2_schema is the specification of operators for structuring symmetric primitive operators. The conditional use of an operator.

schema.name: nut_and_bolt_3_schema
schema.introduction: The subject of the nut_and_bolt_3_schema is the use of symmetry primitives to provide additional structuring of symmetry primitives. A sequence of operators

resource.tech_discussion: The symmetry primitive operators provide an alternative representation for geometry, built up from features. These operators also form a closed self-referent set that is extensible to any topological space.

examples.p: I am thinking that a usage guide is tech discussion plus examples, but interleaved rather than in two separate annex clauses as here.

The Examples will consist of a set of nested subclauses with just about anything in them. But first I have to sort out how to create the subclauses. I have failed in my first attempt to create a nested clause element that includes text-elts and block-elts and single-block-elts.
